summary: Email correspondence between attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding a witness's expiring E-2 work visa and her request for a law enforcement declaration to support renewal. The witness is assisting with an investigation and there is uncertainty about her visa status due to the case resolution and pandemic.

persons.name: Aaron Mysliwiec
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with federal prosecutors about a client's visa issues and request for a law enforcement declaration to support visa renewal.

persons.name: Erica T. Dubno
persons.context: Attorney copied on correspondence regarding a client's visa issues and request for a law enforcement declaration.

connections.description: Both are attorneys working together on a client's visa matter and corresponding with federal prosecutors.

events.title: Witness's E-2 visa expiration
events.description: A witness's E-2 work visa is set to expire in March 2021, prompting her attorneys to seek a law enforcement declaration to support renewal.

keyFacts: A witness assisting with an investigation has an E-2 work visa expiring in March 2021.
The witness's attorneys are seeking a supporting declaration from law enforcement to help with visa renewal.
Uncertainty exists about visa renewal due to the resolution of the case, the witness's work history, and the COVID-19 pandemic.
To apply for visa renewal, the witness must be outside the U.S., which could prevent her from continuing to assist the investigation if denied re-entry.
